intro: Hoita rhomboidea, commonly known as the rhombic hoita, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rhombus-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
